intro: Chaptalia turquinensis, commonly known as the Turquin's chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Chaptalia turquinensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
